title: Can't mount an NFS server from a worker node
content:
When you try to mount an NFS server from a worker node, you receive a warning message that resembles the following:

Warning FailedMount1m (x107 over 3h) kubelet, worker1Hostname.domain.com (combined from similar events): MountVolume.SetUpfailed for volume "itom-vol" : mount failed: exit status 32

Cause

The cause of this issue is unknown.

Solution

  1. On the NFS server, follow these steps to make sure the NFS server supports NFSv3.0:
    1. Open the /etc/sysconfig/nfs file in an editor. For example, run the following command: 
      vim /etc/sysconfig/nfs
    2. Set the value of the RPCNFSDARGS parameter to "-V 3 -V 4". Save the change and exit the editor.
    3. Run the following commands to restart the NFS service: 
      systemctl restart nfs-config
systemctl restart nfs-server
  2. On every control plane and worker node, follow these steps:
    1.  Open the /etc/nfsmount.conf file in an editor. For example, run the following command: 
      vim /etc/nfsmount.conf
    2. Set the value of the Defaultvers and Nfsvers parameters to 3. Save the change and exit the editor.
    3. Run the following command to restart NFS: 
      systemctl restart nfs
